item.title: India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 3: AUS claim BGT after a decade with 6-wicket win, IND out of WTC Final race - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia Highlights, 5th Test Day 3: AUS claim BGT after a decade with 6-wicket win, IND out of WTC Final race

Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a thrilling match, Australia claimed the Border-Gavaskar Trophy after defeating India by 6 wickets, clinching the series 3-1. This win marks a significant moment for Australia, who had not won the trophy in a decade.

  • Travis Head (34*) and Beau Webster (39*) led Australia to victory.
  • India's Jasprit Bumrah missed the match due to injury, impacting India's bowling lineup.
  • Australia scored 162 runs to win after India was bowled out for 157 in their second innings.
  • Scott Boland achieved a remarkable 10-wicket haul across both innings.
  • India is now out of contention for the World Test Championship Final.
“Unreal. Few of us didn't have. Lived up to all the hype...Immensely proud.” - Pat Cummins

Overall, Australia's strong performance throughout the series allowed them to regain the trophy, while India faced challenges due to injuries and missed opportunities.

item.title: "Have To Be Fair": Gautam Gambhir's Blunt Take On Future Of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Have To Be Fair": Gautam Gambhir's Blunt Take On Future Of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 • Source: NDTV

In a recent press conference, India head coach Gautam Gambhir addressed questions regarding the future of senior players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma following the team's defeat in Sydney.

  • Gambhir refused to comment definitively on the future of Kohli and Sharma, citing their 'hunger' as a deciding factor.
  • He emphasized the need to be fair to all players in the team, regardless of experience.
  • Both players have struggled with form recently, raising questions about their selection for upcoming matches.
  • Rohit Sharma appeared in an interview expressing his commitment to continue playing despite retirement rumors.
  • The selectors face challenges in deciding the future of the veteran players as India prepares for a series in England.
"I can't comment on the future of any Players, it is up to them. They have the hunger and commitment - hopefully they can do everything they can to take Indian cricket forward." - Gautam Gambhir

The upcoming selections for India's Test squad will significantly impact the team's future dynamics, especially concerning seasoned players like Kohli and Sharma.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir Hugs Virat Kohli, Picture Triggers Social Media Storm - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir Hugs Virat Kohli, Picture Triggers Social Media Storm

Publication Date: January 5, 2025

Source: NDTV

The recent hug between Gautam Gambhir and Virat Kohli during India's tour of Australia has sparked discussions on social media amidst India's struggles in the Test series.

  • India faced a 6-wicket defeat in Sydney, eliminating them from the World Test Championship final contention.
  • The social media photo of Gambhir hugging Kohli raised concerns about Kohli's future in the Test team.
  • Australia won the series 3-1, qualifying for the World Test Championship final against South Africa.
“Gautam Gambhir hugs Virat Kohli.” — Mufaddal Vohra, Jan 5, 2025

The emotional moment shared between the two players has captured the attention of fans, reflecting the anxieties surrounding the Indian cricket team's performance and players' futures.

item.title: How invincible Jasprit Bumrah was let down by colossal batting failures and dubious selections - The Indian Express
item.description:
India lose BGT: How superhuman Jasprit Bumrah was let down by colossal batting failures and dubious selections

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Indian Express

India suffered a 1-3 defeat against Australia in the Border Gavaskar Trophy, mainly due to inconsistent batting performances while Jasprit Bumrah's bowling was exceptional, ending the series with 32 wickets.

  • Bumrah's remarkable performance was overshadowed by India's poor batting average of 24.67 compared to Australia's 28.79.
  • India's batting failures included lack of significant contributions from key players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal stood out as India's best batter with 391 runs.
  • Questions were raised over team selection, particularly the choice of spinners on a green pitch.
  • Australia made fewer errors, clinching the trophy they sought after eight years.
“It is just a different ball game, a different planet, that Bumrah is playing on compared to everyone else.” - Adam Gilchrist

The series highlighted the need for improvements in India's batting consistency and tactical decisions moving forward.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 5th Test Day 3: Mohammed Siraj picks Usman Khawaja, AUS 125/4 vs IND in Sydney - The Indian Express
item.description:
AUS beat IND by 6 wickets and win series 3-1 in Sydney

Date: January 4, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Australia successfully chased down a target of 162 runs, beating India by 6 wickets and securing the series 3-1. A strong performance from Scott Boland, who took six wickets, helped reduce India to 157 runs in their second innings.

  • Australia scored 162 runs for 6 wickets in their second innings.
  • India's Prasidh Krishna claimed 3 wickets during Australia's innings.
  • Rishabh Pant's significant 33-ball performance helped India to a first-innings lead.
  • There are concerns regarding Jasprit Bumrah's fitness after he faced a back spasm.
“Match Ended (Day 3 - 5th Test) - Australia beat India by 6 wickets”

This match concluded with Australia emerging victorious, marking a successful series for them against India.

item.title: Virat Kohli imitates sandpaper scandal after Steve Smith's dismissal - Watch - The Times of India
item.description:
Virat Kohli Imitates Sandpaper Scandal After Steve Smith's Dismissal

Date: Not provided
Source: Times of India

Virat Kohli engaged with the crowd during a recent Test match against Australia, humorously imitating the infamous sandpaper scandal following Steve Smith's dismissal, showcasing his connection with fans and his vibrant on-field persona.

  • Kohli's dynamic engagement with the crowd is part of his appeal.
  • He often teases the crowd and interacts playfully during matches.
  • Prasidh Krishna provided a strong bowling performance against Australia.
  • Smith's dismissal came as he was on the brink of 10,000 Test runs.
  • Kohli's imitation referenced the sandpaper scandal from 2018, which involved ball tampering.
“The leadership group had devised the plan to tamper with the ball,” - Steve Smith

The incident highlights Kohli's spirited nature and the ongoing engagement between players and fans during high-stakes matches.

item.title: Virat Kohli brutally taunts Australian crowd with cold-blooded sandpaper gesture after Steve Smith's dismissal - Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli Taunts Australian Crowd with Sandpaper Gesture after Steve Smith's Dismissal

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In a charged cricket match in Sydney, Virat Kohli continued his contentious relationship with the Australian crowd by referencing the sandpaper scandal with a bold gesture, leading to an electrifying atmosphere.

  • Kohli responded to audience jeers with a gesture of emptying his pockets.
  • This was a nod to the sandpapergate scandal involving Steve Smith and Cameron Bancroft.
  • The incident occurred right after Smith's dismissal during the innings.
  • Kohli's controversial actions have escalated the tensions between him and Australian fans.
  • Jasprit Bumrah was sidelined due to injury, putting additional pressure on Kohli as captain.
Kohli urged the crowd to boo louder, showing his defiance against their hostility.

Kohli's taunt not only reignites memories of past scandals but signals an ongoing rivalry that keeps cricket fans engaged and the tension palpable.

item.title: Yashasvi Jaiswal stunner puts Steve Smith's massive milestone on hold - WATCH - The Times of India
item.description:
Yashasvi Jaiswal stunner puts Steve Smith's massive milestone on hold - WATCH

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Australia's star batter Steve Smith will have to wait another day to reach the coveted 10,000-run milestone in Test cricket, as he fell for just four runs in the second innings of the fifth Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

  • Steve Smith needed just five runs to become the 15th player in history to reach 10,000 Test runs.
  • He was dismissed for four runs by India's pacer Prasidh Krishna, misjudging a short delivery.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal completed a stunning low catch to dismiss Smith.
  • Earlier, India resumed their innings at 141/6 but added only 16 runs before being bowled out for 157.
  • Scott Boland starred with figures of 6-45.
  • India's Jasprit Bumrah, despite battling back spasms, is set to finish as the leading wicket-taker in the series.
“Smith, needing just five runs to become the 15th player in history to reach 10,000 Test runs, was dismissed for four runs.”

This match marks a key moment in the Test series, as Australia looks to reclaim the Border-Gavaskar Trophy for the first time in a decade.

item.title: India vs Australia 5th Test Day 3 LIVE Score: Krishna derails AUS' momentum with twin strike but IND miss Bumrah - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 5th Test Day 3 LIVE Score: Prasidh Krishna steps up in Bumrah’s absence with 3 quick AUS wickets

Date: Not specified
Source: Hindustan Times

In a thrilling contest on Day 3 of the 5th Test between India and Australia, Prasidh Krishna made a significant impact with three wickets, helping to derail Australia's momentum in their chase of 162 runs.

  • Prasidh Krishna took three crucial wickets early on, including the wicket of Steve Smith.
  • India set Australia a target of 162 runs after being all out for 157.
  • Scott Boland claimed a 10-wicket haul in the match.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's absence was felt, as fitness concerns arose around his back spasms.
  • The match has seen 26 wickets fall in just two days, indicating a challenging pitch for batting.
“If Jasprit Bumrah is fit then 145-150 might be enough. But if Bumrah is not fit then a score of around 200 also might not be enough.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The match remains pivotal for both teams, with India looking to level the series while Australia aims to maintain their dominance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

item.title: Virat Kohli in 'no mood' to retire, but may not be able to justify selection for England tour: 'It would be very hard…' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli in 'no mood' to retire, but faces selection challenges for England tour

Publication Date: Jan 05, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Virat Kohli’s ongoing struggles in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy have sparked discussions about his future in the Indian Test team as he finishes the series with only 190 runs across nine innings.

  • Kohli shows visible frustration after repeated dismissals, indicating rising concerns about his form.
  • Despite a historic career, Kohli’s place in the upcoming England tour is being questioned due to lack of recent red-ball cricket.
  • He has expressed no intention to retire, aiming for participation until the 2027 ODI World Cup.
  • Former selectors suggest Kohli must play domestic red-ball matches to maintain his spot in the squad.
  • He has yet to show interest in participating in the Ranji Trophy due to his packed schedule.
“It would be very hard for selectors to pick either Rohit Sharma or Virat Kohli on the basis of IPL performance or form.”

The upcoming England tour represents a pivotal moment for Kohli, as he is expected to contribute significantly in ODIs but questions persist if he can regain his form in Test matches before then.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah's absence forces Mohammed Siraj to open bowling against Australia on Day 3 at SCG - The Times of India
item.description:
Mohammed Siraj Opens Bowling Against Australia as Jasprit Bumrah Misses Day 3

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

India's leading bowler Jasprit Bumrah was unable to play on Day 3 of the fifth Test against Australia due to back spasms, prompting Mohammed Siraj to take over opening duties.

  • Bumrah batted after bowling just one over before leaving the field due to injury.
  • India set Australia a target of 162 runs after being dismissed for 157 in their second innings.
  • Scott Boland achieved figures of 6-45, leading the Australian bowling attack.
  • Rishabh Pant scored a notable 61, becoming the top scorer for India.
  • Australia lead the series 2-1, needing a win or draw to reclaim the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
"If they win or draw, it would also put them into the World Test Championships final in June at Lord's against South Africa."

This match highlights the struggle for India without their star bowler, while Australia aims for a significant series victory.

item.title: Pat Cummins Creates History, Becomes 1st Bowler In The World To... - News18
item.description:
Pat Cummins Makes History as First Bowler to Reach 200 Wickets in WTC

Date: January 05, 2025 | Source: News18

Star Australian fast bowler Pat Cummins created history by becoming the first bowler in the world to take 200 wickets in the World Test Championship on January 5, 2025. He achieved this milestone by dismissing Washington Sundar during a Test match against India at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

  • Cummins is the first bowler to take 200 wickets in the World Test Championship.
  • He reached this milestone by bowling out Washington Sundar while he was on 12 runs.
  • Cummins has 73 wickets in the ongoing WTC edition (2023-25).
  • He led Australia to the WTC title win against India in 2023.
  • Pat Cummins is followed by Nathan Lyon with 196 and Ravichandran Ashwin with 195 wickets in WTC all-time rankings.
“It’s a tremendous achievement and a testament to hard work and dedication.” – Pat Cummins

This achievement further solidifies Cummins' position as one of the leading bowlers in international cricket and highlights his contributions to the Australian team in Test matches.

item.title: 'Not His Battle To Fight': Ricky Ponting On Sam Konstas' Heated Exchange With Jasprit Bumrah - News18
item.description:
Ricky Ponting Comments on Sam Konstas' Interjection in Bumrah-Khawaja Clash

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 21:36 IST

Former Australia skipper Ricky Ponting criticized Sam Konstas for involving himself in a verbal exchange between Jasprit Bumrah and Usman Khawaja during the Sydney Test. Ponting emphasized that it was unnecessary for Konstas to intervene in the matter.

  • Ponting condemned Konstas' actions, stating it was not his place to step in.
  • He hoped for a discussion in the Australian dressing room regarding the incident.
  • Ponting advised against upsetting Bumrah, who has been impactful in the series.
  • He expressed disdain for time-wasting tactics in cricket, suggesting it can backfire.
  • Australia suffered as Bumrah dismissed Khawaja on the last delivery of Day 1.
“I didn’t like Konstas getting involved. That was not his battle to fight.” - Ricky Ponting

The incident highlights the importance of senior players managing their disputes without unnecessary interference from younger players.

item.title: Arsenal player ratings vs Brighton: Ethan Nwaneri's a gem but Joao Pedro steals more points from Gunners to give Mikel Arteta a real headache in Premier League title race - Goal.com
item.description:
Arsenal Player Ratings vs Brighton: Nwaneri Shines Despite Draw

Publication Date: [Date not provided] | Source: GOAL

The match ended in a 1-1 draw, impacting Arsenal’s Premier League title chase. Young talent Ethan Nwaneri scored early, but Joao Pedro equalized for Brighton.

  • Ethan Nwaneri became the first Arsenal player to score multiple Premier League goals before age 18.
  • Arsenal led 1-0 until Brighton equalized through a penalty.
  • Injuries to key players Mikel Arteta's team favored lineup adjustments.
  • Arsenal now sits five points behind league leaders Liverpool, who have two games in hand.
“The draw saw Arsenal move to within five points of leaders Liverpool.”

This match presents a significant challenge for Arsenal’s title ambitions as they face mounting pressure in the league.

item.title: Yuzvendra Chahal shares cryptic post amid divorce rumours with Dhanashree Verma - India Today
item.description:
Yuzvendra Chahal's Cryptic Post Fuels Divorce Rumours with Dhanashree Verma

Published On: Jan 4, 2025 | Published By: Diya Kakkar

Indian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal has sparked speculation about his marriage to Dhanashree Verma with a cryptic Instagram post, amid reports of their potential separation.

  • Chahal shared a cryptic message on Instagram, possibly reflecting on his personal struggles.
  • Reports indicate that Chahal and Dhanashree have unfollowed each other and deleted shared photos, which has intensified divorce speculations.
  • Sources suggest they have been living separately for months and their marriage appears to be crumbling.
  • The couple married in December 2020 after meeting during the pandemic.
“Hard work spotlights the character of people. You know your journey. You know your pain…”

The ongoing silence from both parties regarding the rumors leaves fans uncertain about the future of their relationship.
